strings:
<se_low>King Trode: For heaven's sake!
What ARE you doing!?

<se_low>King Trode: Why are you talking to me when you should be talking to them!?
We've a million and one questions to ask them!
<se_low>Yangus: Blimey lummy...

<se_low>Yangus: Here we are, eh?
We've finally caught up wiv Dhoulmagus.
I dunno wot to do wiv meself.

<se_high>Jessica: ‘Finally caught up’?
I don't feel like we actually did anything!
<se_high>Jessica: It's more like Dhoulmagus cornered himself for us!

<se_low>Yangus: BLIMEY lummy!
...I s'pose I can't stand 'ere sayin' that forever.

<se_low>Yangus: Betta save the blimeys for after we've defeated Dhoulmagus.
It's action we need now, not speeches!
<se_high>Jessica: I'm starting to get the feeling this might be a trap...

<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe that Dhoulmagus didn't attack us before he ran into the ruins.<page>Jessica: I mean, think about who we're dealing with here.
He HAS to be up to something.
<se_def>Angelo: I didn't like the way Dhoulmagus looked at us and laughed before he disappeared off inside the ruins.

<se_def>Angelo: If we're going in, we should be wary.
You never know what he might have up his sleeve.
<se_low>King Trode: Dhoulmagus couldn't have chosen a more irritating place to hide himself away!
<se_low>King Trode: I just hope he doesn't leave and disappear somewhere else while we're absent procuring the magic mirror.
<se_low>Yangus: We can't get in the Dark Ruins wivout this magic mirror wotsit, right?

<se_low>Yangus: So we'd betta get over to Argonia then, 'adn't we?
That's where the mirror is.

<se_high>Jessica: Argonia.
Isn't that where Princess Medea's fiancé lives?

<se_high>Jessica: Well, why don't we use that as our introduction?
I'm sure the King wouldn't mind...<page>Jessica: Actually, scratch that.
It would be a really bad idea.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't think he'd be particularly happy to learn that his son was betrothed to a horse.
<se_def>Angelo: What they said sounded plausible enough, but didn't you get the impression they were just too scared to take Dhoulmagus on?
<se_def>Angelo: ...Probably very wise.
<se_def>Angelo: If they had decided to take a crack at him, I doubt very much whether they'd be alive right now.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot was that all about!?
One minute we was in there, an' then all of a sudden was back outside.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh! It must o' been one o' them...y'know...one o' them ‘in-eggs-pickleable fun-on-me-nuns’!
A proper weird 'appenin'!
<se_high>Jessica: Huh? What!?

<se_high>Jessica: What was THAT!?
Why are we outside now?
How did that happen?
<se_def>Angelo: The only thing I can say with any certainty about what just happened is that it would be a waste of time to try it again!
<se_low>Yangus: Sweet! If that aura's still 'angin' around, it must mean Dhoulmagus's still inside, right?

<se_low>Yangus: But we ain't no better off, are we?
I mean, 'e might not o' come out, but as long as that aura's there, we can't get in, neither.
<se_high>Jessica: There were three people chasing Dhoulmagus, but now it seems to be down to just one. Did they leave him behind to guard the ruins?
<se_def>Angelo: Guard or not, he's wasting his time.<page>Angelo: If Dhoulmagus did decide to come out, he wouldn't have much trouble finishing off a lone swordsman like him.
<se_low>Yangus: He's puttin' a brave face on, but I bet 'e's really brickin' it!

<se_high>Jessica: Talk about drawing the short straw.
I can't believe his friends left him here all alone.

<se_high>Jessica: By the way, I've been thinking.
What made Dhoulmagus choose the Dark Ruins as his hideout, anyway?

<se_high>Jessica: He could have gone anywhere in the world.
What's so special about this place?
<se_def>Angelo: We'll only have more hassle if Dhoulmagus leaves this place before we manage to dispel the dark aura.
<se_low>King Trode: Thinking back to how we felt when we first came here brings a tear to my eye.
<se_low>King Trode: When we discovered the aura was preventing us from getting inside the Dark Ruins, I thought it would be the end of our journey.<page>King Trode: I was quite given over to despair.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm well excited!
I can't wait to see wot's gonna 'appen to the aura when we use the sun mirror on it!

<se_low>Yangus: I reckon there's gonna be one 'eck of a bang!
It'll be a right fireworks display if you ask me!

<se_high>Jessica: Come on, <hero>.
This isn't the time for chit-chat.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's use the sun mirror to break through the dark aura!
<se_def>Angelo: So that edifice is to be the battlefield for our final showdown with Dhoulmagus.

<se_def>Angelo: Your defences are about to be breached now, Dhoulmagus!
Prepare for the fight of your life, my friend!

<se_low>King Trode: I'm counting on you to give Dhoulmagus a good thrashing, <hero>!
Medea and I shall be waiting here.
<se_low>King Trode: We wouldn't want to be a burden to you, and place in doubt the outcome of a battle you would otherwise have won.<page>King Trode: So we shall say farewell here.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe Dhoulmagus'll try 'n' make a run for it when 'e finds out 'is aura's knackered.
<se_low>Yangus: We'll just 'ave to make sure we get to 'im before 'e can get away again.
<se_high>Jessica: I know we're about to walk right into a vicious battle, but I'm really looking forward to this.
<se_high>Jessica: I'm going to take great pleasure in sending Dhoulmagus straight down to hell where he belongs!
<se_def>Angelo: Even if we manage to defeat Dhoulmagus, there may well be less of us coming out of the battle than going in.

<se_high>Jessica: Don't talk like that, Angelo!
You'll jinx us.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't never gonna forget none o' ya!

<se_high>Jessica: Yangus! Not you, too!
Am I the only one NOT planning to kick the bucket here?

<se_def>Angelo: So the time has finally come!
The beginning of the end for Dhoulmagus!
<se_def>Angelo: The moment we finally enter the Dark Ruins will be the last moment he could have escaped with his life.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot was that all about!?
One minute we was in there, an' then all of a sudden was back outside.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh! It must o' been one o' them...y'know...one o' them ‘in-eggs-pickleable fun-on-me-nuns’!
A proper weird 'appenin'!
<se_high>Jessica: Huh? What!?

<se_high>Jessica: What was THAT!?
Why are we outside now?
How did that happen?
<se_def>Angelo: The only thing I can say with any certainty about what just happened is that it would be a waste of time to try it again!

<se_low>Yangus: An' we went to all that bleedin' trouble to get the magic mirror!
Wot a waste o' time!
<se_high>Jessica: What a huge waste of time!

<se_high>Jessica: We should've gone straight to that old man who knows about the magic mirror!
The one the castle scholar told us about!

<se_def>Angelo: What's he talking about!?
It looks like a mirror, its NAME is ‘the MAGIC mirror’, Q.E.D. it's got to have MAGIC in it!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Ah.
<se_def>Angelo: Blast! I'd forgotten about that scholar back at the castle. He said something about not sensing any magic in it too, didn't he?

<se_low>Yangus: It lives up to its name, don't it?
The reflection o' the sun mirror's just like a beam o' sunlight.

<se_high>Jessica: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to ignore you.
It's just that...
Well, we're about to go into the Dark Ruins.
<se_high>Jessica: And that means I'll finally have my revenge for what happened to Alistair.<page>Jessica: It isn't an easy thing, coming face to face with the man who killed your brother.

<se_def>Angelo: Phew!
That was a lucky escape!
<se_def>Angelo: If you were unlucky enough to be standing in the path of a beam of light that strong, it'd burn a hole right through you.
<se_low>Yangus: Cor! It's got some clout, eh, that sun mirror!?
<se_low>Yangus: It's so bright you'd think you was walkin' about outside even in a buildin' wiv no windows.
<se_low>Yangus: Well, maybe that's a bit of an exbadgeration, but ya know wot I mean.

<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't no normal bloke, is 'e?
I dunno if we're gonna win if we 'ave another crack at 'im.

<se_low>Yangus: Cor! Listen to me!
Sorry, I ain't normally so negative.

<se_high>Jessica: I have a request.
Let's pick and choose our battles wisely, okay?
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't conserve our strength, we could find ourselves too weak to give Dhoulmagus the send-off he so richly deserves.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him slip away this time.
Every breath he takes while my brother lies dead is an affront to the very fibre of my being.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm firin' on all cylinders now!
I'm gonna blow 'im to kingdom come!

<se_def>Angelo: Fine, then.
I'll fall in behind you and float around just out of range taking well-timed potshots at him.<page>Angelo: A support role, rather than a front-line position.
<se_low>Yangus: You would do, an' all, wouldn't ya!?
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus may have defeated us before, but it won't be so easy for him next time.
<se_high>Jessica: So long as I have breath in my body, I'll dedicate everything I have to sending that monster back to hell where he belongs!

<se_def>Angelo: Dhoulmagus might've set traps for us.
We should proceed with caution.
<se_high>Jessica: I agree. Any of these treasure chests could be mimics! Having to fight each and every one will only slow us down.
<se_high>Jessica: I think we need to be particularly careful about handling things that have obviously been arranged or lined up on the ground.

<se_high>Jessica: They could easily be ‘presents’ from Dhoulmagus, if you know what I mean.
So let's stay on our toes.
<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus means business, eh!

<se_def>Angelo: By the Goddess!
<Cap><hero>! Look behind you!
Oh, no!
<se_def>Angelo: WATCH OUT!

<se_def>Angelo: Ha ha! Made you look!
Anyway, didn't the shock loosen you up a bit?
Help you relax?

<se_def>Angelo: I've got him cornered now!
We'll take him next time, for sure!
<se_def>Angelo: You'd better prepare yourself for a REALLY serious fight this time, Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>Yangus: Why d'ya reckon Dhoulmagus chose this place, eh?
D'ya think 'e 'ad some reason?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe he was meeting up with his wife?

<se_low>Yangus: He's married!?
How come 'e can get a wife an' I can't!?
It ain't fair!

<se_high>Jessica: Just stop it, you two!
This is no time for joking around!<page>Jessica: Dhoulmagus chose this place because he's a filthy creature that likes dark and dingy places.
All right?
<se_def>Angelo: Oh NO! Dhoulmagus isn't another one of those MOLES, is he!?<page>Angelo: My ears still haven't stopped ringing from our last encounter!
<se_low>Yangus: Grandad an' the 'orse-princess are relyin' on us to take Dhoulmagus out.

<se_low>Yangus: We ain't gonna let 'em down.
We're men, awright, not mice!
Er, no offence, Munchie.

<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't no normal bloke, is 'e?
I dunno if we're gonna win if we 'ave another crack at 'im.

<se_low>Yangus: Cor! Listen to me!
Sorry, I ain't normally so negative.
<se_high>Jessica: So this marks our first real battle with Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: We have no idea what kind of tricks he has up his sleeve. On the other hand, he doesn't know our strategy, either.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him slip away this time.
Every breath he takes while my brother lies dead is an affront to the very fibre of my being.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm firin' on all cylinders now!
I'm gonna blow 'im to kingdom come!

<se_def>Angelo: Fine, then.
I'll fall in behind you and float around just out of range taking well-timed potshots at him.<page>Angelo: A support role, rather than a front-line position.
<se_low>Yangus: You would do, an' all, wouldn't ya!?
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus may have defeated us before, but it won't be so easy for him next time.
<se_high>Jessica: So long as I have breath in my body, I'll dedicate everything I have to sending that monster back to hell where he belongs!
<se_def>Angelo: I'm not usually overly sensitive to the supernatural, but I'm picking up a really nasty feeling around here.

<se_def>Angelo: I've got him cornered now!
We'll take him next time, for sure!
<se_def>Angelo: You'd better prepare yourself for a REALLY serious fight this time, Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya wanna do, guv?
This looks like a dead end.

<se_low>Yangus: Strike the wings, eh?
But wot's movin' them statues gonna do?
They look way too 'eavy to 'it somefin' wiv!
<se_low>Yangus: I know it's just a picture, but it makes ya feel 'orrible burnin' a bird's wings like that, don't it?

<se_low>Yangus: Still, at least it's opened up the way for us.
Better get a move on.

<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't no normal bloke, is 'e?
I dunno if we're gonna win if we 'ave another crack at 'im.

<se_low>Yangus: Cor! Listen to me!
Sorry, I ain't normally so negative.
<se_high>Jessica: So this is where Dhoulmagus is hiding himself?
<se_high>Jessica: So we have to somehow strike the ‘hateful bird’ depicted on the wall, right?

<se_high>Jessica: I have a feeling that we're catching up.
Something tells me that Dhoulmagus isn't far ahead.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him slip away this time.
Every breath he takes while my brother lies dead is an affront to the very fibre of my being.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm firin' on all cylinders now!
I'm gonna blow 'im to kingdom come!

<se_def>Angelo: Fine, then.
I'll fall in behind you and float around just out of range taking well-timed potshots at him.<page>Angelo: A support role, rather than a front-line position.
<se_low>Yangus: You would do, an' all, wouldn't ya!?
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus may have defeated us before, but it won't be so easy for him next time.
<se_high>Jessica: So long as I have breath in my body, I'll dedicate everything I have to sending that monster back to hell where he belongs!
<se_def>Angelo: We're not going to turn back just because we've come to a dead end. We need to explore this hall a bit before we give up.

<se_def>Angelo: This weird ritual or whatever the spirit was talking about... It said it couldn't do it because it doesn't have a physical form.<page>Angelo: But we do.
What's to stop us doing it?
<se_def>Angelo: The spirit certainly wasn't too fond of that Empyrea. But Rhapthorne sounds like a much nastier piece of work if you ask me.

<se_def>Angelo: But who am I to judge?
I don't know anything about either of them.

<se_def>Angelo: I've got him cornered now!
We'll take him next time, for sure!
<se_def>Angelo: You'd better prepare yourself for a REALLY serious fight this time, Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: I don't wanna put a damp'ner on yer fightin' spirit or nuffin', but wot are we gonna do if Dhoulmagus gets down on all fours an' gives us an apology?
<se_def>Angelo: I...don't know!
<se_def>Angelo: As a knight, I am honour bound not to strike an opponent who will not defend himself.

<se_high>Jessica: You? A knight?
Don't make me laugh, Angelo.

<se_high>Jessica: I'll tell you what.
If Dhoulmagus happens to be on his hands and knees, I'll strike first.<page>Jessica: Is that FAIR enough for you, Sir Knight?
<se_def>Angelo: You scare me, Jessica, you really do!
<se_low>Yangus: When it comes to revenge, people do go a bit funny sometimes.

<se_low>Yangus: We've come in a long way, eh?
How much further d'ya reckon it can be?
<se_low>Yangus: The deeper we go, the more gloomy the place gets.

<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus ain't no normal bloke, is 'e?
I dunno if we're gonna win if we 'ave another crack at 'im.

<se_low>Yangus: Cor! Listen to me!
Sorry, I ain't normally so negative.
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe a chance meeting with you brought me here, <hero>.

<se_high>Jessica: I'm grateful to you for that...
And I'm sure Alistair would be as well.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him slip away this time.
Every breath he takes while my brother lies dead is an affront to the very fibre of my being.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm firin' on all cylinders now!
I'm gonna blow 'im to kingdom come!

<se_def>Angelo: Fine, then.
I'll fall in behind you and float around just out of range taking well-timed potshots at him.<page>Angelo: A support role, rather than a front-line position.
<se_low>Yangus: You would do, an' all, wouldn't ya!?
<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus may have defeated us before, but it won't be so easy for him next time.
<se_high>Jessica: So long as I have breath in my body, I'll dedicate everything I have to sending that monster back to hell where he belongs!
<se_def>Angelo: I'll see the Abbot's death avenged, and then I'll be free...to do whatever I want.
<se_def>Angelo: Life at the abbey, losing my family, and my dear brother of course... I'll kiss goodbye to everything in my past for good!

<se_def>Angelo: I've got him cornered now!
We'll take him next time, for sure!
<se_def>Angelo: You'd better prepare yourself for a REALLY serious fight this time, Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>Yangus: The first move's the winnin' move, eh!?
Let's do it!

<se_high>Jessica: Hey!
This isn't the time for a conversation!
Dhoulmagus is right in front of us!

<se_def>Angelo: Don't take your eyes off him!
He's right there!
<se_low>King Trode: It's been quite a task trying to break down this dark aura.
<se_low>King Trode: We finally manage to procure the mirror that's supposed to do the trick, only to find it's utterly useless!

<se_low>King Trode: It's driving me mad!
Doolally, I tell you!
<se_low>Yangus: When I look at the Dark Ruins I see Dhoulmagus's grave.

<se_low>Yangus: But this 'orrible place is still gettin' me down.
Let's get out of 'ere.

<se_high>Jessica: So there were people who prayed for the second coming of the Lord of Darkness...
And they built this shrine?

<se_high>Jessica: Did those people really and truly believe that he would make them happy?
It's hard to fathom.
<se_def>Angelo: If you think about it, this place is like the antithesis of Neos.

<se_def>Angelo: There, people worship the Goddess, and here, people worship the Lord of Darkness.
One's a holy land, and one's a hellish land.

<se_def>Angelo: Although the holy land was sullied slightly when we all found out the Lord of Darkness had been inside the Goddess statue all along!<page>Angelo: Hey!
Maybe the Goddess is in a giant Rhapthorne statue around here somewhere!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought we'd 'ad it when Dhoulmagus chucked them thorns at us.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm a bit ashamed o' meself actually.
I was cowerin' behind you, guv!

<se_high>Jessica: I was happy to come here and avenge my brother's murder.
But now that it's over, I just want to get out.

<se_high>Jessica: There are too many painful memories here.
When I look around, I see Dhoulmagus.
And dead or not, he killed my brother...
<se_def>Angelo: When we finished off Dhoulmagus here, it marked the end of Templar Angelo as well.
<se_def>Angelo: So when I fight Rhapthorne alongside all of you, it won't be as a Templar, it'll just be as a strikingly handsome young adventurer.

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't goin' mad, am I?
We did go inside there chasin' after Dhoulmagus, didn't we?
<se_low>Yangus: So 'ow come we ended up back outside then?

<se_high>Jessica: These ruins are being protected by some sort of evil power.
I can sense it.

<se_high>Jessica: I suspected Dhoulmagus had his reasons for picking this place.
Now, how can we get inside?
<se_def>Angelo: We can stand here scratching our heads all day, but I don't think we're going to figure out how to get inside.

<se_def>Angelo: Why don't we try asking that lot over there?
They might know something.
<se_high>Red: Oh yeah, this place reeks o' treasure, that's for sure. But I'll be honest, I ain't too keen on 'angin' around 'ere.

<se_low>Morrie: Do the people who worship the Lord of the Darkness hate our world? Do they want to see
it ending, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Or maybe they think the Rhapthorne is gonna show them the way to happiness? Make everything <endash> How do you say it? <endash> dunky-hory?
<se_low>Morrie: Hmm... Si, the hearts of the humans are more harder to comprend than the minds of the monsters, ay?
<se_high>Red: I dunno much about that Dhoulmagus geezer, but in the end 'e was just bein' controlled by Rhapthorne an' all, right? And this is where it all came to an 'ead, eh?
<se_high>Red: Who knows, maybe the bloke felt grateful to you lot in the end for stoppin' 'im, eh? I mean, deep down an' that.
<se_low>Morrie: The Lord of the Darkness has many faithful followers, ay? Maybe there are more places in the world like this one, where people worship to him...
